mdRecord.dcterms:description: "... The current church building (fifth meeting house) was constructed in 1872 to a design by Henry Hobson Richardson. It opened in 1875 to serve the Unitarian congregation of the Brattle Street Church, also known as the Church in Brattle Square, which had been demolished in 1872.[5] The Unitarian congregation dissolved in 1876 soon after moving to this building.[6] The First Baptist congregation bought the building in 1882..." -- http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/First_Baptist_Church_%28Boston,_Massachusetts%29 [work]
